body: Yeah, the API should be able to do pretty much everything the UI can do, so +1 for this

I'm currently looking into this so I would like to get assigned to this :)
By the way it would be good if we could discuss the method and the parameter names for this API action.

I would start from ability to remove sites:

`/sites/action/removeSite/`

params:
`url - delete a site's url (exact match)`
`recurse - delete all sites that contain the url`

IMHO the first implementation should be as close to gui functionality as possible. If there's any reason to be different it should be extended functionality, and we should consider if it's useful or applicable to gui use as well.

You dont want to orphan any content. Think of it like a tree, if you cut a branch you don't expect the leaves to stay in place defying gravity. (They go with the branch.)

issue.title: Implemented deletion of nodes via API. Fixes #2342

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
This patch will fix the issue #2342 . The user will now be able to delete the Site Nodes of the scanned site via the API too and not just the GUI. The functionality for now is just similar to the GUI that is if a parent is chosen then all of its children are deleted as well without the choice of leaving the children and just deleting the parent. The user can also specify the method as a parameter.

Would like your reviews @thc202 , @kingthorin , @psiinon  :)

body: @DarkPrince304 @kingthorin your suggestions make a lot of sense!

@kingthorin the nodes could be left in place (with temporary requests), like when the nodes are created for a request with a path with many segments. But it might not be a required/useful functionality.

I downloaded the most recent docker image with weekly build and experience the following issue (running it on Ubuntu in headless mode: zap.sh -daemon). Seems it happens when I delete site via API:

> 414035 [ZAP-ProxyThread-236] ERROR org.zaproxy.zap.extension.history.PopupMenuPurgeSites  -

@DarkPrince304 may be you can look into it
